intro: Espeletia occulta subsp. oroquensis, commonly known as the Oroquén Mountain heather, is a striking plant native to the Andean region of Colombia. It is characterized by its dense, compact rosettes of silver-gray leaves that are covered in fine, white hairs. The plant produces showy, pink or purple flower clusters that bloom in late summer, adding visual interest to its habitat. It thrives in high-altitude environments, often found in cloud forests and paramo ecosystems. Due to its unique appearance and ecological significance, it is a subject of interest for botanists and conservationists alike.
